hath stinge though hee hath thrust forth wounde v man hath malice though hath outwardly shewed may sin come god foreseeth already past recoūteth shall stand argument god man would plead man charge yet certaine certaine murther presently wrought better commit offence may healed repentaunce sin wherein place lefte contrition rather let liue sinne may recover themselues go • hence bee seene reason sufficient raze history machabees canon scripture author therof commendeth fact razis beset nicanor • ounde aboute meanes escape fell owne sword missing stroke ranne wall breake necke yet life whole within ranne people gate top rocke bloud spent gushing like founteine hee tooke bowel handes threw vpon people calling vpon lord life spirit hee woulde restore againe vnto died story commendeth manfull valiant act aquinas thinketh otherwise saith haue killed themselues avoide trouble vexation mala poenalia estimantes se fortiter agere quaedam mollities animi number razis thinking doe manfully notwithstanding true fortitude rather certaine effo • minatenesse minde able endure cross pronounce nothing rashlye mercy god may come inter pontem fontem proverbe betweene bridge brooke inter gladium iugulum betweene sworde man throate laste wordes razis testifie petion father life spirit bowelles might restored excepting conclusion difference pray betweene cato lib 3 ep 24 whome seneca writeth large last night hee lived hee red plato bookes cleombrotus taking sworde hand said fortune thou hast done nothing withstanding endevours haue hitherto fought mine owne liberty liberty countrey neither haue dealt vnmoueably liue free selfe non vt liber sed inter liberos might liue amongst free men affaire mankinde irrecoverable let cato bee horne rest stabbed body wound bounde vp physitians lesse bloud minus sanguinis idem animi lesse strength yet courage novve angry againste caesar alone owne person hee tumbleth handes wound sendeth forth leasure properly violence eiecteth generous spirit skorning disdeigning higher power commaunde heare betake themselues desperate refuge pointe sworde razis avoide nicanor cato caesar alleadge good countrey private estate impatient misery come reproach disgrace captivity might bring vpon misse fatall stroke implacably bent proceede voluntary homicide tosse embrue handes owne bowelles one reposeth himselfe vpon god goodnesse without hope rest hee cried cato deducatur tutum let cato goe quiet place commended valiant death certaine cato died impatience minde occîdit enim se ne diceretur caesar servavit hee killed himselfe might bee said caesar hath saved seneca affirmeth much might bee happy man either kill preserue cato valerius maximus reporteth wordes caesar hee found dead cato envie thy glory thou enviedst mine folly rather madnesse men feare death enforced death hee addeth singular preceptes wise valiant man must flie timore mortis coguntur ad mortem non fugere debet è vitâ sed exire libido mori endi non doe delighteth true god absolute praedominant soveraigne vvill vvhere hee vvill hee taketh mercie vvhere vvill hardeneth ground complainte good though missapplie itrom 9 vvho hath resisted go farre therefore sinne sinne darkest darkenesse hell easie requite haue spilte bloud innocent like water vpon grounde defiled neighbour bed troubled earth provoked heauen vvith many pernitious infamous mischiefes rape robbery proditions burninges spoylings depopulation c spewe blasphemy righteousnesse selfe countenauncing sinnes authoritie hateth sinne pleading haue done god outrage knovv vvill god though stave yron handes heartes resist shall done vngracious vnwillinge vnbeleevinge instrumentes shall doe service god dreame god saith kill contradict wee kill even though violate law god yet accomplished hath hooke nostrelles bridle chawes vvicked suppose adde iudge yee vvhat saie lord giue vnderstanding thinges hath spurres flankes side neuer imagined senacharib founde bridle stay hooke turne backe pharaoh spurre driue forwarde vvill harden heart pharaoh exod 4 many place let alone let take pleasure pastimeexod 8 hath hardened ovvne heart malice also harden iustice thus god one way renounced sure hee liveth raigneth heauen shall time action way perfourmed yet men wicked though god would god holy iust though would wicked beguile thēselues heerein fallacy taken owne net lay purpose thus presume hee doth god sinneth true keepe commandements honour god obey prince loue thy neighbour thy selfe voluntas signi recorded holy writ published abroade signified flesh proclaimed afflicted vnder correction apostolique iudgement let pray shall else doe shall follow vvaies wicked prophet describeth wicked prowde hee seeketh god psal 10 hee saith evermore heart god hee boasteth thereby mine hearte plentifullest en • rease corne wine oile bring others lastly shall hee doe shall hee adde griefe vnto griefe welcome woe vnto shal drinke downe pensiuenesse behemoth drinketh downe ingenia moribus suis quàm legibus vti maluerunt vvho good lavves ill nature rather vse manner lawes excellent men athens despightfully basely required theseus buried rock miltiades dyed prison sonne miltiades vvho inherited nothinge amongst father bandes solon aristides phocion lived banishmente shoulde bring action athens courte cittye vvere able aunswere iust exprobrations athens thy wals thy people thy trophees triumphes farre neare lande sea thus thus multiplyed horum authores vbi vixerint vbi iaceant responde put thine aunsvvere shevve vvhere authours thinges lived vvhere buryed god hath action ingratitude sonnes bringeth lawe citty nation note horror vice heaven earth corner creature vvorlde may knowe detest surelye well marked learned man man wondreth dog wolues common habitation departed remooved mee like shepheardes tente vveaver cutteth threade life ended heere hee confesseth open tearmes soule invvarde immortall heavenly substaunce vvhich bodye fainteth till hath vnloaden selfe vvhale feeling morsell vvithin vvhich hee cannot turne nutriment shoulde hee doe owne quiet riftings reaching stomacke sende foorth thus saide hypocrite iob twentith vvho hath vndone manie spoiled house hee never builded vvhose wickednesse vvas sweete mouth perhappes ionas mouth fish hee hidde vnder tongue c meate bowel turned gall aspes middest hee devoured substance shoulde vomit vp god woulde draw bellie hee shoulde restore labour devour • ee shoulde feele quietnesse bodie neither reserue thing vvhich hee desired heare large nature surfitte doubtlesse ill gotten forth vnreasonable action sometimes common iudgement spirit dull lumpish sorrowe shee cannot abide recreation anye creature shee heavinesse shee wisheth endevoreth vttermost provocation onely men beastes nay tree stone might mourne light heaven woulde accompany dolefull passion shee thinketh sunne shoulde shine shee taketh pleasure brightnesse thereof lillie field shoulde bee clothed blacke shee apparrelled infante draw breast beast take foode hath appetite neither doth envious affectiō bee far meaning humble meeke repentāce feeling weight sinne alwaies chewing cud god offended shee runneth pleasure world serpent shee panteth sobbeth day night shee weareth handes wringing breast smitinge vppon pauement cabbin pleaseth best anguish breade drinke salt teares till shee get comfort god peace fearing withall decay declination within selfe shee shall bee wearie soone well dooing sorrowes end teares bee dried vp▪ haue washt sufficiently except bee nourished shee saith within selfe thou foresawest end would bee thou lookedest oughtest thou therfore haue refused thy message necessity laid vpon thee thou mightest well assure thy selfe woe would haue lighted vpon thee many haires hand heale letteth thee alone sixe iniquity seventh pull thee garment thou shalt offend side wretched man lord correcteth whose first messenger monitioner first borne death life taken hee seeth sin duplicatum jgnis noster illumina • non accēdit 1 mā ner reprehensiō fire giveth light shining kindleth lead men righte vvay vnto knowledge wee bring practicke better part divinity feele pricking calleth humiliation shee ascended high asketh shall fetch downe yet haue red whose wimple calles perewigges haue beene turned nakednes baldnes haue run fro smiting breastes tearing haire heades suffering blowne eares wind regarding bind vp much hairelace clock vvell kept horologium bene ordinatum camini boni chimneyes good haue heard two signes well ordered common wealth hour mispent calling followed breathing chimney choked vp hospitalitie reliefe poore almost banished poorer haue plague already skarsitie bread within yeares often renewed teeth haue beene clean • white want food haue beene furred excesse meat drinkes rich men gentleman looke also draught cup lord either mortal sickenes body eate vp flesh haue eaten others whose shall thinges bee much sweat browes carefulnes heart wracke conscience breach charitie wrong humane society haue laid togither • barbarous vnmercifull souldior lay open hedge reape field rifle coffer barbarus segetes levell house ground empty possession
